law.catch_line: After a hearing, the Administration may:...

text.section:
After a hearing, the Administration may:
Refuse, suspend, or revoke the license or privilege of an applicant or licensee;
Rescind, continue, or modify any prior action; or
Take any other action permitted by the Maryland Vehicle Law.

If a decision or order of the Administration is adverse to any party to the hearing, the decision or order:
Shall be made in accordance with § 10-221 of the State Government Article; and
Unless service is waived by the party, shall be served on the party or the party's attorney.

Subject to § 10-209(b) and (c) of the State Government Article, and except as otherwise provided in this article, if a party fails to appear for a hearing scheduled under the Maryland Vehicle Law, the Administration may:
For a hearing scheduled under § 12-203 of this subtitle, impose the sanction proposed in the notice; or
For a hearing scheduled under § 12-202 of this subtitle, order:
A suspension of the party's license or privilege until the party appears for a hearing; or
The imposition of any sanction proposed in the notice.
